learning_outcomes.description: Identify and correct misconceptions and fallacies about the financial system embedded in financial arguments or discourses.
Represent financial operations and discourses using an accounting framework to check their rigour and predict their impact.
Apply economic theories such as demand-supply and arbitrage theories to the financial system to get a deeper understanding of financial matters.
Understand and critically assess complex and recent financial developments in the financial system.
Assess the immediate and later effects of monetary and macroprudential policies on the functioning of the financial markets and behaviours of financial institutions.

assessments.task_description:
8 best tutorial online tests out of 12 (from week 1 to week 12) in person during the tutorials. These take the form of 1) multiple choice questions checking that the concepts covered in the tutorial have been understood and 2) a very short question, also related to the exercises solved in the tutorial. Trying the exercises with peers and being attentive during the tutorial should be enough to get full marks.

As these tests require to be taken in person, it is essential that you enrol in a tutorial slot that you can really attend. You can be absent to 4 tutorials without any consequence, so please do not contact us if you cannot make up your regular tutorial. You could check if there is a seat at another tutorial if you exceptionally cannot attend your regular one but do not wish to miss a test. Enrolled students in a class will always have priority.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.category: Essay/ Critique, Examination, Quiz, Tutorial/ Problem Set
assessments.task_description:
This assessment is a supervised in person exam of 100 minutes (10mn reading time + 90mn working time). 

Students must advise of and seek permission from employers for their study and examination commitments at the beginning of the semester as the usual demands of employment are not grounds for a deferred exam to be approved.

The exam covers topics 0 - 4 .The exam comprises 1) MCQ of the same nature of online tests 2) exercises of the same nature as in tutorials with, however, different questions and 3) critical writing questions around statements to assess as true, false or unclear (and more importantly to justify) and extracts taken from the media to explain and assess with the content of the course.

The writing standards are very high in the course. Very precise and complete answers are expected, with concepts to be defined before being used, choice of approach to be justified, all stages of calculation to be shown, and result to be interpreted. Giving directly a result with no details and explanations will give students half the marks at most. More information will be provided closer to the date.

See more information and advice on the mid-term exam format on Bb under Assessment closer to the date.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.category: Essay/ Critique, Examination, Quiz, Tutorial/ Problem Set
assessments.task_description:
This assessment is a closed-book, supervised exam held on Campus at a day and time scheduled by the University. 

Students must advise of and seek permission from employers for their study and examination commitments at the beginning of the semester as the usual demands of employment are not grounds for a deferred exam to be approved.

The exam covers topics 5-11. Be aware that given the interdependence among topics a good understanding of topics 0-3 is essential too. The final examination comprises 1) MCQ of the same nature as training tests 2) exercises of the same nature as in tutorials with, however, different questions and 3) critical writing questions around statements to assess as true, false or unclear (and more importantly to justify) and extracts taken from the media to explain and assess with the content of the course.

The writing standards are very high in the course. Very precise and complete answers are expected, with concepts to be defined before being used, choice of approach to be justified, all stages of calculation to be shown, and result to be interpreted. Giving directly a result with no details and explanations will give students half the marks at most. More information will be provided closer to the date.

See more information and advice on the final exam format on Bb under Assessment closer to the date.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
